parameters.definition: Total land area operated by the oil and gas company
Barrels of oil produced per acre by a small oil well
Barrels of oil produced per acre by a large oil well
Pollution units produced by a small oil well per acre
Drill bits required by a small oil well per acre
Pollution units produced by a large oil well per acre
Drill bits required by a large oil well per acre

description: An oil and gas company operates on \param{TotalLand} acres of land where they use oil wells of small and large size. Per acre of land, a small oil well can produce \param{OilSmall} barrels of oil. Per acre of land, a large oil well can produce \param{OilLarge} barrels of oil. However, a small oil well produces \param{PollSmall} units of pollution and requires \param{DrillBitSmall} drill bits per acre and a large oil well produces \param{PollLarge} units of pollution and requires \param{DrillBitLarge} drill bits per acre. The company has available \param{TotalDrillBits} drill bits and due to strict environmental laws can produce at most \param{MaxPollution} units of pollution. For how many acres should each oil well be used to maximize the total production of oil?
